page.title: 09Twinning Ceremony
page.content: On{27th of July 1985,}more than 100 {Bretons}from{Pluguffan}near Quimper attended an{official}ceremony at Llandovery where the{friendship pact was{sealed.}On{25th of August 1984}a similar{ceremony}was held in{Pluguffan where the people of Llandovery received a{stained glass window. In the Twinning ceremony at the Church Hall the Bretons received a locally {carved wooden plaque}and a framed{calligraphy scroll. The purpose of the twinning is to {promote cultural, tourist and economic {exchanges}which will benifit both communities. The ceremony was conducted in three languages,{Welsh, Breton}and{French.
